messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] AnneO
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/4/2004 5:06:17 PM Eastern Daylight Time, starsuncloud@netzero.net writes: And  thanks, Kelly, for that superb introduction...funny how
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/4/2004 5:06:17 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
starsuncloud@... writes:

"And thanks, Kelly, for that superb introduction...funny how you couldn't
think of that at the last conference when you introduced me as a "big, fat
poopyhead." Now Kathryn is thinking I should be a big, fat poopyhead, too."

She use THAT, instead of my poetic version?? Ack!
ENCHANTRESS Kelly, not POOPYHEAD!!




<<<<<

Don't go blaming ME, Ren! Anne TOLD me to say that! I was just following
orders! <g>

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: AnneO
messages.msgSnippet: And thanks, Kelly, for that superb introduction...funny how you couldn t think of that at the last conference when you introduced me as a big, fat
messages.messageBody:
"And thanks, Kelly, for that superb introduction...funny how you couldn't think of that at the last conference when you introduced me as a "big, fat poopyhead." Now Kathryn is thinking I should be a big, fat poopyhead, too."

She use THAT, instead of my poetic version?? Ack!
ENCHANTRESS Kelly, not POOPYHEAD!!

Although the former has more laugh appeal.:)

And damn-it-all. I MISSED it too.

Ren, forever chasing Jalen at conferences


Learn about unschooling at:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/unschoolingbasics/

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] AnneO
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/3/2004 9:43:18 PM Eastern Daylight Time, Onesnotenough@aol.com writes: Anyone  care to clue me in on this wonderfully sounding  person?
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/3/2004 9:43:18 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
Onesnotenough@... writes:

Anyone care to clue me in on this wonderfully sounding person?
syndi<<<<<




Anne Ohman is a regular writer/contributor on the unschooling.com message
boards. She was a featured speaker at the first two Live and Learn Unschooling
Conferences in Columbia, SC and is this year's Keynote Speaker in MA. She
lives in NY state, has two sweet, darling boys, Jacob and Sam. Several of her
writings are available to be read on Sandra's site and on the message boards
almost daily.

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: AnneO
messages.msgSnippet: Anyone care to clue me in on this wonderfully sounding person? syndi ...since  we can t know what knowledge will be most needed in the future, it is senseless
messages.messageBody:
Anyone care to clue me in on this wonderfully sounding person?
syndi

"...since we can't know what knowledge will be most needed in the future, it
is senseless to try to teach it in advance. Instead, we should try to turn
out people who love learning so much and learn so well that they will be able
to learn whatever needs to be learned."
-- _John Holt_ (http://www.quoteworld.org/author.php?thetext=John+Holt)


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
